Barracuda, Small

This fish is long and bluish gray fading to mottled silver near it tail. It has an oversized jaw full of sharp teeth.


Small Barracuda

CR 1/4

XP 100
N Small animal (aquatic)
Init +3; Senses low-light vision; Perception +5
DEFENSE
AC 14, touch 14, flat-footed 11 (+3 Dex, +1 size)
hp 4 (1d8)
Fort +2, Ref +5, Will +1
OFFENSE
Spd swim 70 ft.
Melee bite +4 (1d4-1)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
STATISTICS
Str 8, Dex 16, Con 11, Int 1, Wis 12, Cha 2
Base Atk +0; CMB -2; CMD 11 (can't be tripped)
Feats Skill Focus (Perception), Weapon FinesseB
Skills Perception +5, Swim +11; Racial Modifiers Small barracudas use their Dexterity modifier for Swim checks.
ECOLOGY
Environment any aquatic
Organization pair, pack (2-5), or school (6-11)
Treasure none

The barracuda is a predatory fish that averages about two feet long and weighs 10-15 pounds. Its body is bluish-gray near the front changing to silver mottled with black spots in the rear. Its mouth is filled with razor-sharp teeth. Medium barracudas are about six feet long and weigh 30-45 pounds. Large barracudas are about ten feet long and weigh 50-80 pounds.

The barracuda strikes quickly in combat. Slain prey is devoured immediately.
